intro: Tanarius roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and produce small seeds dispersed by the wind. Tanarius roxburghii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
